description: This course focuses on international financial markets and exchange rates. Topics include pricing in the foreign currency and Eurocurrency markets, use of forward exchange for hedging, short-term returns and market efficiency in the international money markets, foreign currency options, international capital asset pricing, pricing of foreign currency bonds, currency swaps, Eurocurrency syndicated loans, foreign currency financing and exposure management.
name: INTL FINANCIAL MARKETS

values.comments:
FNCE 219 focuses on international financial markets and exchange rates. Topics include pricing in the foreign currency and Eurocurrency markets, use of forward exchange for hedging, short-term returns and market efficiency in the international money markets, foreign currency options, international capital asset pricing, pricing of foreign currency bonds, currency swaps, Eurocurrency syndicated loans, foreign currency financing and exposure management.

Many students claimed that the material taught in Professor Ng’s FNCE 219 overlapped significantly with earlier classes such as FNCE 100 and FNCE 101. Furthermore, they were frustrated that the professor was seemingly unfamiliar with what they had already been taught.

While students found Professor Ng to be “enthusiastic” and exude a “good sense of humor,” they were nonetheless unimpressed with his abilities to teach FNCE 219. They highlighted his reliance on lecture slides and inability to address students’ questions and concerns adequately. Further, students complained that much of his texts and sources used in class were generic and unoriginal. Many found that he was not familiar enough with the material to effectively communicate it in the classroom.

Students entering FNCE 219 with Professor Ng should be prepared for lengthy problem sets and strong textbook focus. Many students found the curve to be brutal because the basics were overemphasized and the exams were insufficiently challenging.
